comments.content:
I'm probably wrong but as I don't know too many compressed thin sans like this one (and also because of this /S), I'd probably start with [Chalet Comprimé](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724101719/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/chaletcomprime) Milan 60/80 mainly lowering crossbars of /A, /H and /E.  
Some more: [Cyclone](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724101719/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/cyclone/overview) Inline, [Maxwell Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724101719/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/kimmy/maxwell-sans) UltraLight, [Catorze27](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724101719/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scannerlicker/catorze27-style1) Light, [Title Gothic Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724101719/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/title-gothic-light), [Rama Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724101719/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/rama-gothic) Expanded Thin, [Cactus](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724101719/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alias/cactus) Light, [Heroic Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724101719/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typetrust/heroic-condensed) Light
